replies.body: When i saw yasuo got nerfed. I was like {{champion:432}} collecting his chimes
high as fuck?
wtf. that's not a fuckin nerf. i would hardly even call it a modification.
it's likely as close to a nerf as we'll ever get.
does this mean that item sets are coming in 7.11 or am I reading it wrong?
No, you got it, they're coming
I'm pretty sure they said patch 7.10...

No, we misinterpreted that; their said it would be on PBE in Patch 7.10, which most of us saw as them coming in the 7.10 PBE cycle and released when it shipped for live, but they actually meant that it would be testing _at the same time_ as when 7.10 was live.
Why are you nerfing Tabis? Not its fault that there are 3-4 ad champions every game.
No, but it IS it's fault when even when there ISN'T that many AD champions it's still better than any other boot choice.
mercs?

Mercs only matter when there is hard CC (think Malz suppress or silence or Annie's Tibbers), that is going to seriously effect your play at getting caught or being stopped in a team fight. Where as tabis are just all around good when there isn't much CC and you're just wanting to outduel any AD without building an armor item besides GA and Tabis, and then you just build something like Maw, Mercurial for your MR. It's been a build that bruisers have been abusing for quite a while now, and it's probably good that it's getting nerfed for balance reasons (even if I dislike the nerf to my own champs lol)
Worth noting that malzahar's suppress is NOT reduced by tenacity from any source.
I T E M S E T S

Riot is killing so many memes lately I'm starting to think Dragon Master {{champion:50}} is no longer a matter of if, but when now.

please...

Summary: "Yasuo got nerfed"
Saved you some time.
Nah, he's still just as strong; there's simply more room to play against him now.
What you're saying doesn't make sense. He can't be "just as strong" because his stack timer went down an entire four seconds.

He is just as strong.  His base values, scaling values, cooldowns, etc are all still the same.  He just has a slightly smaller opening and it's a bit more telegraphed to the enemy when he's going to use the tornado.  His relative strength is still the same.

No {{champion:498}} nerfs? Also, it would be nice if we could have a roles tab in champ select. Meaning, you could organize your top lane champs into the "top" tab and your mid lane champs in the "mid" tab or something like that. It would make things much more convenient and organized

People still need time to understand how she works before they issue any changes. Honestly, people not paying attention to where her feathers are is 50% of her success. When a good amount of players get wise to her tricks, then they'll be able to accurately pin how she is doing.
Why does a champ with an average pick rate and a 50% win rate need a nerf?
Now Yasuo will be banned twice every game. Good.
Why must malzahar's minions get nerfed again, have they not had enough over last few patches.
They are getting nerfed in order to make room for compensation buffs in his main abilities.

the point being, he's a pet mage so his voidlings being so weak is retarded, some extra strength into his abilities would be great on other burst mages but Malz is not other burst mages and his voidlings really should be a significant aspect of his kit. I'll miss my Malzahar and his precious Cancer Babies, because now he's really not Malzahar anymore, it's a matter of his identity.
Old Malz wasn't focused around his voidlings so I find it strange that you feel that he is a "pet mage"

> [{quoted}](name=DJ Malzahar,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=iTEVOQbA,comment-id=0011000200000000,timestamp=2017-06-01T03:58:39.247+0000)
>
> Old Malz wasn't focused around his voidlings so I find it strange that you feel that he is a "pet mage"

lol even Riot acknowledged when they reworked him that his voidlings were a significant part of Malzahar's identity and that he was supposed to be the go to pet mage for league, one of the reasons the devs gave for making the voidlings a basic ability was to help him realize his fantasy as the master pet mage. I played old Malz a lot and before the rework AD Malz was the most common build on him outside of bronze, I played it often myself as it was quite fun, so I'd say his voidlings were a significant part of his kit, they did deal 50% of his TOTAL AD at that point and if you knew your casting rhythm well enough you should've had a voidling out almost constantly even on AP Malzahar and they actually did respectable damage and had decent health at that point and made a hell of a lot more of a difference in fights than the current pathetic voidlings do.

I believe they did 100% of his AD pre-rework and that was the basis for his ad being so good, and after the rework yes, they did focus around him being a minion-mancer but pre-rework I only ever saw myself play him AD in my matches. 

While the voidlings are great for adding a jungling/voidling based playstyle that is completely different from other mages, they are impossible to balance around while keeping any other playstyles viable so I personally prefer having versatile spells that can be used for zoning, peel, and damage than focusing on voidlings that they've only had work in a way that was fair/balanceable as his passive.

And just to clarify, while the reworked malz is definitely pet focused, I was just saying that besides the niche jungle malz gameplay he wasn't _**focused**_ around it as much as his other spells and overall anti-diver/ burst mage playstyle.

I am not a fan of the Malzahar changes. By making voidlings less durable and shifting damage to his other skills he becomes less unique. I don't know if I'm in the minority here but I enjoyed the update (the original one from last midseason) that made his gameplay significantly revolve around his voidlings. It made him play and feel different from every other champion in the game. It additionally introduced mastery in the building and control of voidling swarms and windowed power around the timing of voidling cooldowns as well as learnable counterplay for opponents. The less Malzahar's voidling matter and the easier they are to kill the more he becomes about his combo, at which point he's no different than any other burst mage.

Furthermore, easily answered but not telegraphed mechanics traditionally have lead to champions being strong at low levels of play where players don't know how to answer them but weak at higher levels of play (E.G. Teemo's Mushrooms). If Malzahar is balanced around opponents killing his voidlings he will be unbeatable at low leves, if he is balanced around his voidling damage he will be unplayable at high levels.

TLDR: the Malzahar changes make him less fun, less unique, and harder to balance

There has been a very noticeable group of people who have been asking for them to move away from the voidlings since 6.9.

Reasons being that they don't like the unreliability of the post-rework voidlings, and that the original malz's theme and playstyle was never really about voidlings with the exception of ad malz which is more effort than it's worth nowadays. The more and more they try to balance around voidlings, the more he's like a squishier yorick.

While I understand the desire to be more reliable, how is malzahar differentiated from other mages if his voidlings don't really matter? Isn't he just a slightly different annie or veigar or brand or... you get the idea? I guess what I'm trying to say is I personally would prefer an unreliable but unique champion over a reliable but boring champion.

I totally agree, I used to main AD Malz and while his main damage source was unreliable he was tons of fun and it was a tradeoff you accepted for the advantage of that dope AD voidling damage and being able to knock over towers and solo dragons. I think a game like League should focus on the uniqueness of its champions otherwise 130+ champs get redundant.
Balance Team, if you're reading this, keep an eye on Malzy's Voidlings. See if their health is enough come late game, especially with how they now die from one tower/champ AA.
Feels like they are just going to die to random AOE abilities every team fight now. Feelsbadman.
Runaan's Hurricane will auto kill all 3 of them at once so it won't matter.

Lol voidlings are useless now, they ought to just remove them because there's really no point. They absolutely will not be able to provide anything significant for Malzahar besides maybe in the jungle or clearing a wave while the enemy laner is backed because they might as well not exist if there's an enemy champ nearby. Such a fucking stupid change for THE pet mage, so many better ways to have fixed him like changing his retarded passive that resulted in most of his abuses, or making the voidlings more dependent on AD for damage so AP Malzahar can't shred you with his voidlings even with absurd AP and AD Malzahar could shred you with voidlings but doesn't deal much magic damage. That's how it used to be for AD Malzahar but Riot seems determined to keep AD Malzahar completely non viable even when it would make him so much easier to balance and way healthier if they would just bring it back.

The problem I see with what they did to malzahar is the minions will almost NEVER reach their target... Without the speed to priority targets plus the fact you can only spawn them a centimeter away from yourself, it takes them way too long to travel for the 1 shot thing to be okay, and they also mostly don't get to participate in your ult unless you are right next to the enemy...The health they get for non-auto or turret based hits basically doesn't exist for champions, and most of the time jungle monsters. Most aoe is just going to 1 shot them with their health, as would a lot of other mid laner spells (played a few games and I've seen it happen constantly). Funneling the damage from his minions into the r also leaves it open for someone to just rush qss and then your r just does no damage as it cuts off the damaging beam. Before, yeah, they could do that, but at least it didn't completely get rid of a ton of your all in damage.

MALZ CANT EVEN JUNGLE RIGHT NOW. Since he would have to use q and e to get 3 voidlings, before level 3 he wont be able to clear a single camp, and even then it will be a struggle. Malz jg is dead. AD malz is dead, hell normal Malz is dead, now its "when is my ult up?" Malz. Cuz they put all the power into using your entire combo and praying it kills.
wish u guys would do something about feeder and afk in co-op i mean like game start than they just rush in and die over and over again like they r bots r something

Yeah, they're bots. 

The best thing to do is report them as Cheating and just say they were botting. Patching something like that is tough, since there are always a few ways to go about scripting.
You can add ten bans but can't fix mac players not being able to launch league for past 3 weeks? Nice priorities riot.
should just get a setup thats actually good for games? :^)
Adding more to the client when it's not even operational.
The client is very much operational, on real computers.

One of the saddest patch notes I've ever read was this patch's note for Renekton.
"We've reverted all of the cool things we did for Renekton in the last two patches."
Hopefully you can help him again soon.
OMG SION IS VIABLE AGAIN!!! YES!!!{{champion:14}}
Viable again? Bruh, he was my first Diamond mastery. I don't play him often because it just seems a little too easy sometimes. Sion's Q makes him a menace at level 1.
Sion has been viable for a long time. He's been my go-to top laner for a long time, as he works well against a lot of champions. He also scales really well into a late game, high damage/cc tank.

Will Renekton be visited again soon?
Quite a lot of bug fixes are reverted, it would be really sloppy if those bugs would stay in.
